ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] I'm considering taking the game back up, but I have a question first.
ygData.msgSnippet: Undoubtedly no.  There has been so many changes to the game since those two expansions that  you d invariably have a very difficult time trying to level and
ygData.messageBody:
Undoubtedly no.  There has been so many changes to the game since those two expansions that  you'd invariably have a very difficult time trying to level and get better gear.  Sure you could still find places to level, but it would take you longer and you'd be missing out on A LOT of great enhancements.  I'd highly reccomend if you're gonna get back into it to spend $30 and buy whatever bundle pack is available with all the expansions.   Since Luclin there has been Planes of Power, Legacy of Ykesha, Lost Dungeons of Norrath, Omens of War, Dragons of Norrath, and a 9th one which I am forgetting.   I really think each expansion definitely offers something that makes the expansion worth getting.  So good luck in whatever you decide to do.
 
Wulfric
 
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: dwmitch
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, July 22, 2005 7:03 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] I'm considering taking the game back up, but I have a question first.

Three years ago I played using the Kunark and Luclin expansions. If I
were to invest the ~$15 per month to start playing again would it be
enjoyable if those were the only two expansions I played with?
